    • Method Detail

      • attachHardcodedFilters

        public static void attachHardcodedFilters(AmpColumns c)
        Attaches hard coded filters for hard coded columns. The FUNDING columns are hard coded, because they do not appear in amp_columns table, therefore they cannot have persisted AmpColumnsFilters, thus the objects will be created manually
        Parameters:
        c - the object to which the hard coded filters will be attached

      • generateColumnFilterSQLClause

        public static java.lang.String generateColumnFilterSQLClause(AmpARFilter f,
                                                             java.util.Set<? extends ColumnFilteringInfo> filters)
        Generates the column filter sql query for a given column, by reading the mapped properties that can affect this column, related with the filter bean. Then the bean is queried to get the values for those properties and the SQL clause is generated
        Parameters:
        f - the filter bean as it is generated by the filter form
        c - the column for which the filtering SQL clause is created
        exclusive - if true, it will generate an SQL clause linked with AND operators , otherwise it will use OR
        Returns:
        the complete SQL logical clause

      • appendFilterRetrievableColumns

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> appendFilterRetrievableColumns(java.util.List<AmpReportColumn> extractable,
                                                                              AmpARFilter filter)
        Append filter retrievable columns to list. those are columns that appear in the current filter as selections and for filtering to be correctly applied the content of the columns has to be present (it holds extra metadata like percentages, etc...) TODO: during refactoring this would become a simple method within AmpARFilter (see the getNormalColumnFilters() and getPledgesColumnFilters() methods above)
        Parameters:
        extractable - the list of already extractable columns
        filter -
        Returns:
        the no of cols added
        See Also:
        http://bugs.digijava.org/jira/browse/AMP-3454?focusedCommentId=39811#action_39811
